intro: Eomatucana, commonly known as the Brazilian fern, is a species of fern native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, thriving in the understory of dense tropical forests. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Eomatucana plays a vital role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms and small animals.
